data.title: Slow Service
data.text: Service is very slow. Crowd too loud with DJ playing during games. Only show LA teams on main TV's. Your lucky to find a small TV if you're not playing against an LA Team. Finally left and went elsewhere after it took 30 minutes for nachos.

data.title: Super good
data.text: The food is great, they have a really good happy hour. Portion size is large and they have the NFL network so during football you can watch games.

data.title: Nice Outdoor Space, Raw Burger
data.text:
The Skinny:

Parking - garages/lots (fee)
Decor - seaworthy
Restroom - updated and clean
Coke Factor - perfectly carbonated, in a glass
Service - friendly but slow and forgetful
Food - good, not amazing

We picked Caffe Primo because it was close to the Honda Center. We had reservations for 530pm and the place was not busy. I do not understand why waiters feel the need to not write your order down. Our waiter forgot my friend's wine and we needed to ask twice for her to get it. They served my soup at the same time as my meal so the mussels got cold while I tried to finish the soup that wasn't that hot to begin with. They forgot the bacon for another friend's burger. And our one friend who doesn't like seafood ordered a burger with only meat and bread. They brought it out with melted cheese on it and because he didn't write down what she said the order was wrong. They redid the burger and when she cut it in half it was very rare and she ordered well done. So they took it back again. By the time the rest of us were done with our food, the third burger came out. She cut it in half and it was more rare then the 2nd burger, literally red juice coming out and the kitchen didn't believe her that it wasn't well done and asked the waiter to show them. Ridiculous! They took the burger off the bill and asked her if she wanted anything else but we had to leave. Poor service and lukewarm food, will not be coming back.

data.title: Found it thru the OpenTable
data.text: Chicken (cut in small cubes) in the salad had no taste and no value, so the salad is hugely overpriced, to my opinion. We liked the clam chowder and app.calamary. Pasta had more tomato sauce than crab. Service was very attentive without overpowering. Nice cool minimalists decore with clean communal tables and wooden floors. Five tv screens don't make a conversation difficult. Easy parking choices and safe neighborhood.

data.title: Average Happy Hour Vist
data.text: Visited on a Wednesday early evening for happy hour, after walking past. We ordered house cab sav and a Moscow Mule. The cocktails were good. For food we had oyster shooters, Mac and cheese and oysters on the half shelf (which were not on happy hour). Great selection of oysters , though a bit in the high price. Food was great! Service was average

data.title: Liked everything
data.text: We were here Friday for the first time and returned today. Loved the outside dining, open barn door space. Great beer choices on tap, friendly fast service, good food. If we lived closer we would frequent! Calamari was delicious, tacos too.

data.title: Great casual cafe in downtown Anaheim
data.text:
Caffe Primo has opened a branch in downtown Anaheim in the new "Center Street Promenade".

Same good food as I've had in their downtown LA location. I love their Italian roasted chicken with roasted potatoes. I prefer the Center Street area to the Packing House. It is less crowded, more reasonable and fun.

data.title: Cocok untuk Bersama Teman
data.text: Tempat ini cocok sekali untuk menonton pertandingan dan agak sedikit ramai. Makanannya lumayan enak, saya pesan cheesy fries dan mushroom burgernya,.
